Description: Angels carrying the Arms of the Archbishop of Greinffencllau, with a view of Würzburg Pen and grey ink and grey wash, over black chalk
Curator's comments: Acquired as a study for the etching by Tiepolo, but now recognsied as a copy after the frontispiece of Domenico Tiepolo's 'Idee Pittoresche', a series of etchings consisting of 27 plates: three introductory, and 24 with the story of the Flight into Egypt. They were etched between 1750-2, and published in 1753 in Wurzburg. The BM has the entire set in an album, and five single prints mounted. The BM loose impression of the frontispiece is 1865,1014.344. Christel Thiem suggested in her review that the same copyist might be responsible for the twenty-four pen-and-wash drawings after Domenico's 'Flight into Egypt' etchings in the Graphische Sammlung, Munich (Z 3038 - 3061; Gernsheim 181383 - 181406). Lit.: H. Trottmann, 'Giovanni Domenico Tiepolos Radierungsfolge Die Flucht nach Ägypten', in exhib. cat. (edited by P.O. Krückmann), Würzburg, Residenz zu Würzburg, 'Tiepolo in Würzburg', 1996, p. 109, fig. 1 (as Domenico); C. Thiem review of exhibition, "Master Drawings", Autumn 1998, 36, p. 309 (as copy)
